page.title: 08THE LAY COMMUNITY AND PERU
page.content: {The Lay community}was begun in 1972 and consists of people of any religion or age who may have jobs outside the Abbey & wish to be involved in the worship & life of the Abbey but with out having to take the vows of {poverty, chastity, & obedience.}The Lay members pool their wages and are given pocket money. This pooled money is used to help build up the community and also in social services. This includes helping the elderly, deprived children, handicapped people, and the {Cheshire Homes.}They organise and finance holidays & weekend visits. The monks also help in{Peru,}they have 3 schools,community buildings and do health work.This work began in 1968 with 4 monks making a monastic foundation, on the{Apurimac River among, helping Indians establish a farm and develop agricultural resource
